comment: Could be a bit more clear on instructions but seems to be lenient on what is accepted for work. Biweekly Group project/paper and alternates with individual presentations + project. The individual project will require some technical knowhow - do not be afraid to reach out for help. Follow syllabus instructions RE: submissions.

This professor has not tried to help any student who reaches out to them. We also received the lab that we were meant to be working on throughout the semester half way through the semester. Not a single PowerPoint is provided. All the work is meant to be researched on your own. Highly would never recommend this Prof

Be ready to deal with a professor that will respond with only, "According to the syllabus". She shows no remorse and or empathy to any inconvenience that may mess you up in regards to submitting an assignment late. If she has already entered a grade she will not take any exceptions whatsoever.

Doesn't give clear instructions. Ask for too much. Multiple presentations that has vague instructions. Too many steps. You must make a presentation, record yourself and send it to youtube, then work with a group about the SAME project to make a collective agreement on what info to use. And if you don't turn in the presentation correctly, you get 0

The only positive that I can say about he is that she is a beyond fast grader. She is not friendly, does not enjoy her job, and uses very derogatory terms to describe students she does not like. If she does not like you she makes sure to tell other students. If she does not like you she will tell you that "you don't deserve a response".

One of the worst classes I have taken at KSU. avoid at all costs completely. Professor is completely out of touch with students and lacks all the abilities to be a successful teacher. Her job as a professor is just her secondary job and that is very obvious through the course material.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: AWFUL, DO NOT TAKE HER!!!! She will not give any instructions for any assignment. When you email her about anything, she will email you rudely. She will not help you. She doesn't teach! All of her assignments are an look up on Google Assignments. Group projects are AWFUL!!! DO NOT TAKE HER EVER!!!!!

I'm nearing graduation and by far this is the worst professor I have EVER dealt with in my four years other than Dr. Green. She has zero course content and her assignment structure is all over the place. NetLab is not easy to access and she does not care whether you can access it or not. You're paying for a class to look up things & teach yourself
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: The most unprofessional Professor I have ever dealt with. This course has 0 content and has incredibly vague instructions for completing the coursework. Do not even bother trying to reach out to her for further clarification if you are stuck, all you will receive is a rude reply about how you already have all the information you need.

Not the best communicator. Most things you must figure out on your own. Lots of presentations so get ready to read, write, and speak. The final assignment is worth like 40 points so make sure you get it done early because it closes way before it's due. Overall the class wasn't that bad, learned a lot. Pace yourself and take advantage of the drafts.

Made an account just to make a review. I don't think this professor is as bad as people say, but be prepared to figure things out on your own. Group project + papers you'll have to write. If the group doesn't do anything, you're stuck doing it all yourself, and you all receive the same grade regardless of individual performance. Read EVERYTHING.

You better hope you remember what you learned in previous courses. There is poor class communication and rude replies when asking questions. However, she is a fair grader so long as you follow directions, and class work is well structured. You will learn a lot, but expect to learn on your own through your own research, not her help.
Awful
She put in a bare minimum effort in teaching.

This class kinda sucked with the sheer amount of work compared to other classes, but it at least prepares you for the beast that is cyber defense. Compared to other classes in the major, you will learn a lot, but get ready to research. People dog on the professor but I think it's just that the class is hard. Not a bad class, definitely difficult.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Fully research based class, No clear instructions. Tough grader and make sure to read the syllabus.

This might have been the worst professor I've ever had. This class is super confusing, and she is no help whatsoever. She gets back within a timely manner but be ready to deal with her rude responses. Super harsh in grading and takes off points even for the smallest mistake. Tried my hardest in this class and still couldn't get the grade I wanted.
Please do not take this class if you value your own personal mental health.

This class is joke. No textbook, no lectures, you get nothing. All you do is Google things for the entire semester and format your Google research into a 10 minute presentation every week. And by the way, you have to configure servers by yourself with NO help. What exactly am I paying all this money for KSU?? Get a cybersec degree somewhere else.

After reading all of the reviews.. all the 5 star reviews sound suspiciously similar with very little substance regarding the class. No lectures, books, PowerPoint, or any guidance of any kind. Every question is answered: "Config file, Google it." By the time you know if you're right or wrong it's too late and it's graded. NOT an educator at all.
she is trash. don't expect any guidance I've dealt with jobs that pay you and give you  more guidance than than this class

I think most of the complaints around this course are from people who aren't used to researching on their own. It's a self-research-based class. The professor isn't there to spoon-feed you. I took the semester very chill and laid back. People tend to overthink this course, but the information is easily accessible. I would take the Professor again.

Anyone else see how all the positive reviews of hers are all similarly worded with the same tone. I think two of them actually use the same language and verbiage. The most recent one sounds like a teacher wrote it as an opening statement to students. Not saying they are fluff or she wrote them, just a bit .... odd.

We go to class at the college level not to research and ingest text, but to benefit from the instructor's experience and years of trial and error and guidance. She provides none of this. Good thing: she has no bias. Because she is apathetic to all students equally. Do not expect a text, PowerPoint, lecture, or any support.

There needs to be new tags for professor's like this.  First of all, not a professor - that is not her title. Second, No textbook, no PowerPoints, no lessons. She gives a subject and tells you to go Google. her little "weekly meetings" are a joke. Ask a question, the answer 90% of the time is, "Config file, Google it".

As others have stated, this class is 100% research-based: no textbook, no lectures, no handouts. Also lots of group work but optionally you can do everything on your own. The professor is there as a guide; doing it right and learning the material is up to you and will take you a LOT of time!
You have to teach yourself the whole course. She provided essentially zero instruction.

Prof. Lesueur can be helpful but can come off as rude, uncaring, and vague. Answers questions and gives feedback promptly. My advice: DON'T PROCRASTINATE on either weekly presentations or status checks. Be prepared for absent teammates, and work on your servers regularly. Be prepared to spend LOTS of time on this class to succeed. Good luck!

This is a tough class and even tougher if she is your professor. Most likely the school will only offer one option so good luck if it is her. The class is "research based" which means you will have to look up and discover everything on your own as there is no course material whatsoever. The servers are fun and I enjoyed teaching myself about them.

Hands down the most annoying course, I've ever taken. Assignments were dreadful, and everything you do is self-taught. You must configure a Linux with MINIMAL help from the professor. I write this rating because the professor is the most condescending, unhelpful, and sour professor I have ever had. She lacks any passion for this job and it shows.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: The Server Checks makes this class absolutely terrible. Joetta may respond quickly through Microsoft Teams, however, the information she provides is unsupportive making it appear she doesn't care or is unknowledge of the subject she "teaches." You are honestly paying a class to learn from Google. Kennesaw should remove Joetta or the class.

I felt like Professor Lesueur could've participated in the class more. She did provide lecture videos, but I felt that she was just reading off the slides instead of truly lecturing. She also gives a ton of weekly busy work and a group project. For the final she does not provide a study guide and expects you to just read the book over and over.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: This is a ridiculously hard class and you WILL have to work for your A. She does try and spice up some very boring material in her slides which I appreciate. Overall, she's amazing, but you NEED to do the work and pace yourself. This isn't an easy A and you have to put your back into it, pace yourself and you'll be fine. Do the work.

Professor Lesueur was awesome. Very helpful when I ran into walls trying to get my servers up and running. The class itself is no joke. It's research heavy and a lot of trial and error in your servers. I wish she would have created some walk through videos or pointed us to some to follow, but overall the class was great. Don't wait to start work!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Not worth the time.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Don't bother taking this course. Every other week, a youtube video is required and then a 20 page paper as well as server checks, WHICH YOU MUST TEACH YOURSELF HOW TO DO. This course revolves around making a server. She does not help one bit. No textbooks, no help, simply google and a prayer that you'll pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: She is an amazing professor. Her class in general is kind of boring, but she tries to make it fun with her slides. Since she's a woman in this industry, it's very inspirational to hear her speak about real world applications. I do think that her tests are rather hard and you will absolutely need to read the textbook to get a good grade.
